Prompt:
Example 1:
Cat and Dog walk. They walk in their village. Then they see an egg. The egg is in the grass. The egg is alone in the grass. The egg is all alone. Cat and Dog walk to a bird. They ask the bird, "Is this your egg?" But the bird says, "No, that is not my egg. Ask the owl. Maybe it is his egg." Cat and Dog walk to the owl. They ask the owl, "Is this your egg?" But the owl says, "No, that is not my egg. Ask the goose. Maybe it is her egg." Cat and Dog walk to the goose. They ask the goose, "Is this your egg?" But the goose says, "No, that is not my egg. Ask the two ducks. Maybe it is their egg." Cat and Dog walk to the two ducks. They ask the two ducks, "Is this your egg?" But the two ducks say, "No, that is not our egg." Then the egg breaks.

Example 2:
The Sun’s light shines on Earth. The light makes our air, land, and water warm. But some things get
warmer than others.
Pretend it is a sunny day. If you wore a black shirt, you would feel hot. But if you wore a white shirt, you wouldn’t feel as hot. The dark color absorbs more of the Sun’s energy. That makes the black shirt warm.
Light colors reflect more of the Sun’s energy. This makes the white shirt cooler to wear. See for yourself! You need a piece of black paper and a piece of white paper. You also need two thermometers and a lamp. Ask an adult to help you.
Fold the black paper so it makes a pocket. Do the same thing to the white paper. Next, put a thermometer into the black pocket. Do the same thing to the white pocket. Then put the pockets under the lamp. Turn the lamp on, and wait for 10 minutes. Then check the thermometers.
Which pocket got hotter — the black pocket or the white one? Do you know why?

Our bodies need food to live. We call this food "nutrition." We eat many different foods. They are fruits, vegetables, meats, and grains. Some foods are good for us. They make our bodies strong. Other foods are not good for us. They make us feel sick. We should eat lots of fruits and vegetables. They are good for our bodies. We can eat them raw or cooked. Apples, bananas, and carrots are good fruits and vegetables. We should also eat grains. They are good for our bodies too. We can eat them as bread or rice. We should not eat too many sweets. They are not good for us. They make us feel sick. We should eat only what is good for our bodies. Our bodies will be strong and healthy. We can run and play. We can be happy and healthy. We need good nutrition to live.

Light colors reflect more of the Sun’s energy. This makes the white shirt cooler to wear. See for yourself! You need a piece of black paper and a piece of white paper. You also need two thermometers and a lamp. Ask an adult to help you.
Fold the black paper so it makes a pocket. Do the same thing to the white paper. Next, put a thermometer into the black pocket. Do the same thing to the white pocket. Then put the pockets under the lamp. Turn the lamp on, and wait for 10 minutes. Then check the thermometers.
Which pocket got hotter — the black pocket or the white one? Do you know why?

Here is the good news: You don’t need a lot of food to have good nutrition. You can get good nutrition from the food you eat every day. Fruits, vegetables, and grains give you the vitamins and minerals you need. But do you know how they do it? Grains have carbohydrates. Carbohydrates are a type of sugar. They help give you energy. Fruits and vegetables have fiber and vitamins. Fiber helps keep your stomach happy. Vitamins keep you from getting sick. Then you will be healthy. Eat a variety of foods every day. This way you will get the vitamins and minerals you need. You will feel happy and healthy. Your body will be strong. You will be able to do many things. Ask your parents to help you make healthy food choices. You can make good choices. You can have good nutrition. You can be happy and healthy. That is the good news. Do you know what to do to make it happen? Try it today.

Using vocabulary and structure from examples, write a short paragraph about 'nutrition' targeting the same readability level (Early Elementary), limited to 200 words. 
Eating healthy is good for you. Nutrition is eating food that makes your body strong. Food is like a car’s gasoline. Gasoline helps the car move. Nutrition helps your body move. But some foods are like junk food for cars. They don’t help the car move well. They might even make the car break down. Some foods are good for you, like fruits and vegetables. They make you strong. They help you run fast. They help you play outside. But junk foods, like candy and chips, don’t help you. They might make you feel sick. So, eat healthy foods every day. They are like gasoline for your body. They help you move and play outside. Always choose foods that are good for you. Your body will thank you. It will be strong and healthy. You will feel good too. So, remember: eat healthy, and be healthy.

- Body

- Start with a basic statement

Food gives our body nutrients. Nutrients are like special helpers that keep our body healthy. But sometimes we don't eat enough food. Our body can start to feel weak. That is not healthy. Using vocabulary and structure from examples, write a short paragraph about 'nutrition' targeting the same readability level (Early Elementary), limited to 200 words. 

Nutrition is important. Food gives us energy to move. It helps our bodies grow strong. We need to eat many different foods. We need fruits, vegetables, and whole grains. Fruits and vegetables have vitamins and minerals. These help us stay healthy. Whole grains have fiber. Fiber helps us digest our food. If we eat a lot of junk food, our bodies might get sick. We need to eat healthy food every day. Then we can run and play with our friends. We can even learn new things in school. Ask your parents to help you make a healthy meal. Choose foods that are colorful. Colorful foods have more vitamins and minerals. Try to eat a rainbow of foods. This will help you be strong and healthy.

Note: The vocabulary and structure of the paragraph should be similar to the examples given, including short simple sentences and a narrative structure. The paragraph should also convey the importance of nutrition in a clear and accessible way. 

Word count: 200 words
